( perhaps bankruptcy). Some elected officials, like California Treasurer Bill Lockyer , say states don't need the ability to file bankruptcy because they have permanent revenue sources: taxpayers. Bill Lockyer told Reuters that states have the ability to enact a tax, and that's not the case of these private corporations that may have unfunded obligations that they can't deal with.
